shockingFailureRate.heading: The Shocking Failure Rate
shockingFailureRate.content: Industry data shows that 90-95% of traders fail prop firm challenges. This isn't by accident—prop firms design their rules to maximize failure rates. They profit from challenge fees, not from successful traders. Understanding why traders fail is the first step to avoiding these pitfalls.

psychologicalTraps.heading: Psychological Traps
psychologicalTraps.intro: The pressure of prop firm challenges creates several psychological traps:

timePressure.label: Time Pressure:
timePressure.text: Strict deadlines force traders to take trades they wouldn't normally take

fearOfFailure.label: Fear of Failure:
fearOfFailure.text: The cost of failing creates anxiety that leads to poor decisions

overtrading.label: Overtrading:
overtrading.text: Traders feel they must trade constantly to hit profit targets

revengeTrading.label: Revenge Trading:
revengeTrading.text: After losses, traders try to "make it back" quickly, leading to bigger losses

riskManagementMistakes.heading: Risk Management Mistakes
riskManagementMistakes.intro: Prop firm rules often encourage poor risk management:

dailyLossLimits.label: Daily Loss Limits:
dailyLossLimits.text: Force traders to stop trading after small losses, preventing recovery

trailingDrawdowns.label: Trailing Drawdowns:
trailingDrawdowns.text: Move against you as you profit, creating a moving target

profitTargetPressure.label: Profit Target Pressure:
profitTargetPressure.text: Forces traders to risk more than they should to hit targets

noFlexibility.label: No Flexibility:
noFlexibility.text: Rigid rules don't account for market conditions

strategyFlaws.heading: Strategy Flaws
strategyFlaws.intro: Many traders enter prop firm challenges without proven strategies. They rely on:

points.untestedMethods: Untested trading methods they saw on YouTube
points.indicators: Indicators that look good but haven't been backtested
points.conditionalStrategies: Strategies that work in some conditions but fail in others
points.noClearRules: No clear entry and exit rules

howToAvoidFailure.heading: How to Avoid Failure
howToAvoidFailure.intro: The key to success is using proven, backtested strategies with clear rules. Instead of guessing what might work, use strategies that have been tested across thousands of trades and various market conditions. This gives you:

points.realisticExpectations: Realistic expectations about win rates and profit factors

backtestAdvantage.heading: The Backtest Advantage
backtestAdvantage.content: Backtested strategies remove the guesswork. You know exactly how a strategy performs before risking real money. You understand its win rate, average win/loss, maximum drawdown, and profit factor. This knowledge gives you the confidence to stick with the strategy during drawdowns and the discipline to follow the rules.
